name: BUILD_ID
description: The current build ID, identical to `BUILD_NUMBER` for builds created in Jenkins versions 1.597+

name: BUILD_NUMBER
description: The current build number, such as `153`

name: BUILD_TAG
description: String of `jenkins-${JOB_NAME}-${BUILD_NUMBER}`. Convenient to put into a resource file, a jar file, etc for easier identification

name: BUILD_URL
description: The URL where the results of this build can be found (for example `http://buildserver/jenkins/job/MyJobName/17/` )

name: EXECUTOR_NUMBER
description: The unique number that identifies the current executor (among executors of the same machine) performing this build. This is the number you see in the `build executor status`, except that the number starts from 0, not 1

name: JAVA_HOME
description: If your job is configured to use a specific JDK, this variable is set to the JAVA_HOME of the specified JDK. When this variable is set, PATH is also updated to include the bin subdirectory of JAVA_HOME

name: JENKINS_URL
description: Full URL of Jenkins, such as `https://example.com:port/jenkins/` (NOTE: only available if Jenkins URL set in `System Configuration`)

name: JOB_NAME
description: Name of the project of this build, such as `foo` or `foo/bar`.

name: NODE_NAME
description: The name of the node the current build is running on. Set to 'master' for the Jenkins controller.

name: WORKSPACE
description: The absolute path of the workspace
